description: Show frame phrase, Brussels, airquality health. What about it
Brussels slides left away from the screen
Air quality slides right away from the screen
Appearance of the question of air quality
show random particles
text: Air consist of gasses and Particles

description: Some particles go to the first compound of the beam at the bottom of the page: Black Carbon
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Black carbon: is a component of fine particulate matter, it is formed through the incomplete combustion of fossil fuels, biofuel, and biomass.

description: Some particles go to the second compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the second compound comes after the first one: Ammonium
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Ammonium: is found in a variety of salts such as ammonium carbonate, ammonium chloride and ammonium nitrate is a component of fine particulate matter. It is found in a variety of salts such as ammonium carbonate, ammonium chloride and ammonium nitrate. Most ammonium is soluble in water.

description: Some particles go to the third compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the third compound comes after the second one: Sea salt
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Sea salt: is a component of fine particulate matter. and is produced by the evaporation of seawater

description: Some particles go to the fourth compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the fourth compound comes after the third one: Sulphate
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Sulphate: is a component of fine particulate matter. Sulphates occur as microscopic particles (aerosols) resulting from fossil fuel and biomass combustion. They increase the acidity of the atmosphere and form acid rain.

description: Some particles go to the fifth compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the fifth compound comes after the fourth one: Soil Dust
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Soil Dust: is a component of fine particulate matter. Soil dust comes from wind-raised dust from parched earth surface and traffic dust from badly maintained roads.

description: Some particles go to the sixth compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the sixth compound comes after the fifth one: Others
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Others: is still a component of fine particulate matter. These particles are not measurable but still there.

description: Some particles go to the seventh compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the seventh compound comes after the sixth one: Organic matter
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Organic Matter: is a component of fine particulate matter. It is matter composed of organic compounds that have come from the remains of organisms such as plants and animals and their waste products in the environment.

description: Some particles go to the eight compound of the beam at the bottom of the page. the eight compound comes after the seventh one: Nitrate
Just above the beam a tag explain what this part of the beam is about
text: Nitrate: is a component of fine particulate matter. Nitrate salts are found naturally on earth as large deposits, particularly of nitratine, a major source of sodium nitrate.
